consensus_issues.issue_description: Lines 42-43: Explanation of x=-1 endpoint is misleading - states 'negative harmonic series' incorrectly
consensus_issues.quoted_text: At x = -1: ∑ (-1 / n) diverges (harmonic series with alternating signs becomes the negative harmonic series).
consensus_issues.student_impact: Students may misunderstand why series diverges at x=-1, confusing alternating series with sign-flipped harmonic series
consensus_issues.suggested_fix: At x = -1: ∑ (1/n) diverges as the harmonic series (the (-1)^n and -1 terms cancel).

consensus_issues.issue_description: Line 3: Module Title is 'Todo' placeholder - blocks student understanding of content scope
consensus_issues.student_impact: Students cannot identify module topic from title, preventing effective navigation and content selection
consensus_issues.suggested_fix: Change to: <Title>Power Series: Radius and Interval of Convergence</Title>

consensus_issues.issue_description: Lines 10-14: Four dense paragraphs of abstract definitions before any concrete example
consensus_issues.quoted_text: Power series, written as ∑ aₙ(x - c)ⁿ... coefficients aₙ.
consensus_issues.student_impact: Students encounter heavy abstraction without scaffolding, likely causing cognitive overload before engagement
consensus_issues.suggested_fix: Start with specific example (e.g., geometric series ∑xⁿ), then generalize to abstract definition

consensus_issues.issue_description: Line 24: Jumps to applying ratio test without explaining why we need it
consensus_issues.quoted_text: To find the radius of convergence, we apply the ratio test:
consensus_issues.student_impact: Students may not understand connection between convergence and the ratio test
consensus_issues.suggested_fix: Add: 'The ratio test helps us determine which x values make the series converge. We apply it:'

consensus_issues.issue_description: Line 6: LearningOutcomes is 'Todo' placeholder - students don't know what they'll achieve
consensus_issues.student_impact: No clear learning objectives prevents students from tracking progress
consensus_issues.suggested_fix: Add: <LearningOutcomes ids='8.1.1,8.1.2'/> or define specific outcomes

consensus_issues.issue_description: Line 10: Term 'foundational tools' is vague - doesn't explain why power series matter
consensus_issues.quoted_text: Power series... are foundational tools in calculus
consensus_issues.student_impact: Students miss motivation for why they're learning this topic
consensus_issues.suggested_fix: Replace with: 'power series let us represent complicated functions as infinite polynomials, making them easier to analyze'

consensus_issues.issue_description: Abstract definition appears before a concrete example (authoring guideline prefers concrete→general)
consensus_issues.quoted_text: A power series is written as ∑ a_n (x - c)^n ...
consensus_issues.student_impact: Abstract-first increases cognitive load for target learners
consensus_issues.suggested_fix: Introduce a concrete example (e.g., geometric series) before presenting the general definition

consensus_issues.issue_description: Jump to test application without bridging why it is needed (missing rationale before ratio test)
consensus_issues.quoted_text: To find the radius of convergence, we apply the ratio test:
consensus_issues.student_impact: Students may not connect the test to the learning goal
consensus_issues.suggested_fix: Add a one-sentence rationale linking convergence to the ratio test before applying it

consensus_issues.quoted_text: It shows the behavior near c
consensus_issues.student_impact: Ambiguity makes self-study harder for low-confidence learners
consensus_issues.suggested_fix: Replace with explicit noun: 'The graph shows the behavior of the function near c'

consensus_issues.issue_description: Line 4: Description is 'Todo' placeholder - missing module overview
consensus_issues.student_impact: Students lack overview of what they'll learn, reducing motivation and preparation
consensus_issues.suggested_fix: Add: <Description>Learn to determine where power series converge using radius and interval of convergence tests</Description>

consensus_issues.issue_description: Line 5: KSAs is 'Todo' placeholder - missing learning prerequisites
consensus_issues.student_impact: Students don't know if they have prerequisites, may waste time or feel lost
consensus_issues.suggested_fix: Add: <KSAs>Sequences and series, ratio test, geometric series</KSAs>

consensus_issues.issue_description: Line 13: Mathematical notation inconsistent - uses |aₙ / aₙ₊₁| without <m> LaTeX tags
consensus_issues.student_impact: Raw Unicode subscripts may not render consistently across devices, reducing accessibility

consensus_issues.issue_description: Line 24: Infinity symbol ∞ used without LaTeX tags
consensus_issues.student_impact: Plain text 'infinity' less clear than proper symbol, may confuse students

consensus_issues.quoted_text: Now let's examine a more complex example.
consensus_issues.student_impact: Minor clarity issue, may slow reading
consensus_issues.suggested_fix: Consider: 'Now, let's examine a more complex example.'

consensus_issues.issue_description: Inconsistent series notation between general and specific examples
consensus_issues.student_impact: Notation switches may confuse students about whether different symbols represent different concepts
consensus_issues.suggested_fix: Establish consistent notation early: use aₙ for general case, then show specific examples

consensus_issues.issue_description: Use of 'thus/therefore/hence' — prefer 'so' per style guide
Mathematical symbol or numeral outside <m>…</m> tags
consensus_issues.student_impact: Raw unicode or plain text math may not render consistently
consensus_issues.suggested_fix: Wrap math/ numerals in <m>…</m> as per style guide

non_consensus_issues.quoted_text: There is a horizontal asymptote at y = 0
non_consensus_issues.student_impact: Less direct phrasing adds cognitive load
non_consensus_issues.suggested_fix: Use subject-verb order: 'The graph of f has a horizontal asymptote at y = 0'

non_consensus_issues.issue_description: Sentence fragment 'This represents the distance...' - should connect to previous sentence
non_consensus_issues.quoted_text: This represents the distance from the center c
non_consensus_issues.student_impact: Choppy flow may distract struggling readers
non_consensus_issues.suggested_fix: Combine: 'The radius of convergence R represents the distance...'

non_consensus_issues.issue_description: Potential contraction usage — ensure no contractions per style guide
non_consensus_issues.quoted_text: Now let's examine a more complex example.
non_consensus_issues.student_impact: Consistency with style guide improves clarity for ESL learners
non_consensus_issues.suggested_fix: Rewrite to avoid contractions: 'Now, let us examine a more complex example.' or remove 'let us' entirely.

non_consensus_issues.issue_description: Check serial comma usage for lists (style requires Oxford comma)
non_consensus_issues.student_impact: Missing serial comma can introduce ambiguity
non_consensus_issues.suggested_fix: Use the serial comma: 'power series, intervals, and coefficients'

non_consensus_issues.issue_description: Pronoun usage ('you/they/it') discouraged by style guide unless unavoidable
non_consensus_issues.student_impact: Pronouns can introduce ambiguity for struggling readers
non_consensus_issues.suggested_fix: Replace with explicit nouns where possible, keep 'we' minimal and purposeful

non_consensus_issues.issue_description: Semicolon usage discouraged by style guide
non_consensus_issues.student_impact: Semicolons can increase complexity for mobile readers
non_consensus_issues.suggested_fix: Split into two sentences or use a comma with conjunction

all_findings.issue_description: Lines 10-14: Four dense paragraphs of abstract definitions before any concrete example
all_findings.quoted_text: Power series, written as ∑ aₙ(x - c)ⁿ... coefficients aₙ.
all_findings.student_impact: Students encounter heavy abstraction without scaffolding, likely causing cognitive overload before engagement
all_findings.suggested_fix: Start with specific example (e.g., geometric series ∑xⁿ), then generalize to abstract definition

all_findings.issue_description: Line 24: Jumps to applying ratio test without explaining why we need it
all_findings.quoted_text: To find the radius of convergence, we apply the ratio test:
all_findings.student_impact: Students may not understand connection between convergence and the ratio test
all_findings.suggested_fix: Add: 'The ratio test helps us determine which x values make the series converge. We apply it:'

all_findings.issue_description: Line 6: LearningOutcomes is 'Todo' placeholder - students don't know what they'll achieve
all_findings.quoted_text: <LearningOutcomes>Todo</LearningOutcomes>
all_findings.student_impact: No clear learning objectives prevents students from tracking progress
all_findings.suggested_fix: Add: <LearningOutcomes ids='8.1.1,8.1.2'/> or define specific outcomes

all_findings.issue_description: Lines 42-43: Explanation of x=-1 endpoint is misleading - states 'negative harmonic series' incorrectly
all_findings.quoted_text: At x = -1: ∑ (-1 / n) diverges (harmonic series with alternating signs becomes the negative harmonic series).
all_findings.student_impact: Students may misunderstand why series diverges at x=-1, confusing alternating series with sign-flipped harmonic series
all_findings.suggested_fix: At x = -1: ∑ (1/n) diverges as the harmonic series (the (-1)^n and -1 terms cancel).

all_findings.issue_description: Line 10: Term 'foundational tools' is vague - doesn't explain why power series matter
all_findings.quoted_text: Power series... are foundational tools in calculus
all_findings.student_impact: Students miss motivation for why they're learning this topic

all_findings.issue_description: Abstract definition appears before a concrete example (authoring guideline prefers concrete→general)

all_findings.issue_description: Lazy start ('There is/are') reduces clarity

all_findings.student_impact: Less direct phrasing adds cognitive load
all_findings.suggested_fix: Use subject-verb order: 'The graph of f has a horizontal asymptote at y = 0'

all_findings.issue_description: Vague reference ('it/this') without clear antecedent
all_findings.quoted_text: It shows the behavior near c
all_findings.student_impact: Ambiguity makes self-study harder for low-confidence learners

all_findings.quoted_text: Power series, written as ∑ aₙ(x - c)ⁿ... coefficients aₙ.
all_findings.student_impact: Students encounter heavy abstraction without scaffolding, likely causing cognitive overload before engagement
all_findings.suggested_fix: Start with specific example (e.g., geometric series ∑xⁿ), then generalize to abstract definition

all_findings.issue_description: Line 24: Jumps to applying ratio test without explaining why we need it
all_findings.quoted_text: To find the radius of convergence, we apply the ratio test:
all_findings.student_impact: Students may not understand connection between convergence and the ratio test
all_findings.suggested_fix: Add: 'The ratio test helps us determine which x values make the series converge. We apply it:'

all_findings.issue_description: Line 3: Module Title is 'Todo' placeholder - blocks student understanding of content scope
all_findings.quoted_text: <Title>Todo</Title>
all_findings.student_impact: Students cannot identify module topic from title, preventing effective navigation and content selection
all_findings.suggested_fix: Change to: <Title>Power Series: Radius and Interval of Convergence</Title>

all_findings.issue_description: Line 4: Description is 'Todo' placeholder - missing module overview
all_findings.quoted_text: <Description>Todo</Description>
all_findings.student_impact: Students lack overview of what they'll learn, reducing motivation and preparation
all_findings.suggested_fix: Add: <Description>Learn to determine where power series converge using radius and interval of convergence tests</Description>

all_findings.issue_description: Line 5: KSAs is 'Todo' placeholder - missing learning prerequisites
all_findings.quoted_text: <KSAs>Todo</KSAs>
all_findings.student_impact: Students don't know if they have prerequisites, may waste time or feel lost
all_findings.suggested_fix: Add: <KSAs>Sequences and series, ratio test, geometric series</KSAs>

all_findings.issue_description: Lines 42-43: Explanation of x=-1 endpoint is misleading - states 'negative harmonic series' incorrectly
all_findings.quoted_text: At x = -1: ∑ (-1 / n) diverges (harmonic series with alternating signs becomes the negative harmonic series).
all_findings.student_impact: Students may misunderstand why series diverges at x=-1, confusing alternating series with sign-flipped harmonic series
all_findings.suggested_fix: At x = -1: ∑ (1/n) diverges as the harmonic series (the (-1)^n and -1 terms cancel).

all_findings.issue_description: Line 10: Term 'foundational tools' is vague - doesn't explain why power series matter
all_findings.quoted_text: Power series... are foundational tools in calculus
all_findings.student_impact: Students miss motivation for why they're learning this topic
all_findings.suggested_fix: Replace with: 'power series let us represent complicated functions as infinite polynomials, making them easier to analyze'

all_findings.issue_description: Abstract definition appears before a concrete example (authoring guideline prefers concrete→general)
all_findings.quoted_text: A power series is written as ∑ a_n (x - c)^n ...
all_findings.student_impact: Abstract-first increases cognitive load for target learners
all_findings.suggested_fix: Introduce a concrete example (e.g., geometric series) before presenting the general definition

all_findings.issue_description: Vague reference ('it/this') without clear antecedent
all_findings.quoted_text: It shows the behavior near c
all_findings.student_impact: Ambiguity makes self-study harder for low-confidence learners
all_findings.suggested_fix: Replace with explicit noun: 'The graph shows the behavior of the function near c'

all_findings.issue_description: Lines 10-14: Four dense paragraphs of abstract definitions before any concrete example
all_findings.quoted_text: Power series, written as ∑ aₙ(x - c)ⁿ... coefficients aₙ.
all_findings.student_impact: Students encounter heavy abstraction without scaffolding, likely causing cognitive overload before engagement
all_findings.suggested_fix: Start with specific example (e.g., geometric series ∑xⁿ), then generalize to abstract definition

all_findings.quoted_text: To find the radius of convergence, we apply the ratio test:
all_findings.student_impact: Students may not understand connection between convergence and the ratio test
all_findings.suggested_fix: Add: 'The ratio test helps us determine which x values make the series converge. We apply it:'

all_findings.quoted_text: At x = -1: ∑ (-1 / n) diverges (harmonic series with alternating signs becomes the negative harmonic series).
all_findings.student_impact: Students may misunderstand why series diverges at x=-1, confusing alternating series with sign-flipped harmonic series

all_findings.student_impact: Students miss motivation for why they're learning this topic

all_findings.issue_description: Abstract definition appears before a concrete example (authoring guideline prefers concrete→general)
all_findings.quoted_text: A power series is written as ∑ a_n (x - c)^n ...
all_findings.student_impact: Abstract-first increases cognitive load for target learners
all_findings.suggested_fix: Introduce a concrete example (e.g., geometric series) before presenting the general definition

all_findings.issue_description: Lazy start ('There is/are') reduces clarity
all_findings.quoted_text: There is a horizontal asymptote at y = 0
all_findings.student_impact: Less direct phrasing adds cognitive load
all_findings.suggested_fix: Use subject-verb order: 'The graph of f has a horizontal asymptote at y = 0'

all_findings.issue_description: Lines 10-14: Four dense paragraphs of abstract definitions before any concrete example
all_findings.quoted_text: Power series, written as ∑ aₙ(x - c)ⁿ... coefficients aₙ.
all_findings.student_impact: Students encounter heavy abstraction without scaffolding, likely causing cognitive overload before engagement
all_findings.suggested_fix: Start with specific example (e.g., geometric series ∑xⁿ), then generalize to abstract definition

all_findings.issue_description: Line 24: Jumps to applying ratio test without explaining why we need it
all_findings.quoted_text: To find the radius of convergence, we apply the ratio test:
all_findings.student_impact: Students may not understand connection between convergence and the ratio test
all_findings.suggested_fix: Add: 'The ratio test helps us determine which x values make the series converge. We apply it:'

all_findings.issue_description: Sentence fragment 'This represents the distance...' - should connect to previous sentence
all_findings.quoted_text: This represents the distance from the center c
all_findings.student_impact: Choppy flow may distract struggling readers
all_findings.suggested_fix: Combine: 'The radius of convergence R represents the distance...'

all_findings.issue_description: Line 13: Mathematical notation inconsistent - uses |aₙ / aₙ₊₁| without <m> LaTeX tags
all_findings.quoted_text: R = lim |aₙ / aₙ₊₁| as n → ∞
all_findings.student_impact: Raw Unicode subscripts may not render consistently across devices, reducing accessibility
all_findings.suggested_fix: R = lim <m>|a_n / a_{n+1}|</m> as <m>n \to \infty</m>

all_findings.issue_description: Line 24: Infinity symbol ∞ used without LaTeX tags
all_findings.quoted_text: ∑ (xⁿ / n!) from n=0 to infinity
all_findings.student_impact: Plain text 'infinity' less clear than proper symbol, may confuse students
all_findings.suggested_fix: Use <m>\infty</m> or write '...from n=0 to <m>\infty</m>'

all_findings.issue_description: Missing comma after introductory phrase
all_findings.quoted_text: Now let's examine a more complex example.
all_findings.student_impact: Minor clarity issue, may slow reading
all_findings.suggested_fix: Consider: 'Now, let's examine a more complex example.'

all_findings.issue_description: Potential contraction usage — ensure no contractions per style guide
all_findings.quoted_text: Now let's examine a more complex example.
all_findings.student_impact: Consistency with style guide improves clarity for ESL learners
all_findings.suggested_fix: Rewrite to avoid contractions: 'Now, let us examine a more complex example.' or remove 'let us' entirely.

all_findings.issue_description: Check serial comma usage for lists (style requires Oxford comma)
all_findings.quoted_text: … power series, intervals and coefficients …
all_findings.student_impact: Missing serial comma can introduce ambiguity
all_findings.suggested_fix: Use the serial comma: 'power series, intervals, and coefficients'

all_findings.issue_description: Inconsistent series notation between general and specific examples
all_findings.student_impact: Notation switches may confuse students about whether different symbols represent different concepts
all_findings.suggested_fix: Establish consistent notation early: use aₙ for general case, then show specific examples

all_findings.issue_description: Sentence fragment 'This represents the distance...' - should connect to previous sentence
all_findings.quoted_text: This represents the distance from the center c
all_findings.student_impact: Choppy flow may distract struggling readers
all_findings.suggested_fix: Combine: 'The radius of convergence R represents the distance...'

all_findings.issue_description: Line 13: Mathematical notation inconsistent - uses |aₙ / aₙ₊₁| without <m> LaTeX tags
all_findings.quoted_text: R = lim |aₙ / aₙ₊₁| as n → ∞
all_findings.student_impact: Raw Unicode subscripts may not render consistently across devices, reducing accessibility
all_findings.suggested_fix: R = lim <m>|a_n / a_{n+1}|</m> as <m>n \to \infty</m>

all_findings.quoted_text: ∑ (xⁿ / n!) from n=0 to infinity
all_findings.student_impact: Plain text 'infinity' less clear than proper symbol, may confuse students
all_findings.suggested_fix: Use <m>\infty</m> or write '...from n=0 to <m>\infty</m>'

all_findings.issue_description: Missing comma after introductory phrase
all_findings.quoted_text: Now let's examine a more complex example.
all_findings.student_impact: Minor clarity issue, may slow reading
all_findings.suggested_fix: Consider: 'Now, let's examine a more complex example.'

all_findings.issue_description: Pronoun usage ('you/they/it') discouraged by style guide unless unavoidable
all_findings.quoted_text: It shows… / You can see…
all_findings.student_impact: Pronouns can introduce ambiguity for struggling readers
all_findings.suggested_fix: Replace with explicit nouns where possible, keep 'we' minimal and purposeful

all_findings.issue_description: Use of 'thus/therefore/hence' — prefer 'so' per style guide
all_findings.quoted_text: Therefore, the series converges…
all_findings.student_impact: Simpler connectors improve readability
all_findings.suggested_fix: Use 'so' instead of 'therefore', 'thus', or 'hence'

all_findings.issue_description: Mathematical symbol or numeral outside <m>…</m> tags
all_findings.quoted_text: R = lim |aₙ / aₙ₊₁| as n → ∞
all_findings.student_impact: Raw unicode or plain text math may not render consistently
all_findings.suggested_fix: Wrap math/ numerals in <m>…</m> as per style guide
